1.text: Heat the water, sweetened condensed milk, and unflavored gelatin.

2.text: Stir until the gelatin dissolves, then remove the pan from the heat.

3.text: Mix 1⁄2 cup (120 ml) of vodka into the saucepan while it’s warm.

4.text: Pour the mixture into the shot glasses, filling each 1/3 of the way.

5.text: Place the shot glasses in the refrigerator for 30 to 40 minutes.

6.text: Mix the orange gelatin, 1 packet of unflavored gelatin, and water.

7.text: Add 1⁄2 cup (120 ml) of vodka to the mixture.

8.text: Pour the mixture into the glasses, filling each one 2/3 of the way.

9.text: Return the shot glasses to the refrigerator for another 30 to 40 minutes.

10.text: Repeat the same mixing process with the lemon-flavored gelatin.

11.text: Fill the remaining 1/3 of each shot glass with the lemon mixture.

12.text: Place the shot glasses back in the refrigerator for 30 to 40 minutes.

13.text: Combine the box of lemon gelatin with 1 packet of unflavored gelatin.

14.text: Stir 1 cup (240 ml) of boiling water into the gelatin mix.

15.text: Fill each of the shot glasses halfway with the gelatin mixture.

16.text: Place the shot glasses in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.

17.text: Combine the orange gelatin, unflavored gelatin, and boiling water.

18.text: Pour the orange mixture on top of the lemon layer in each shot glass.

19.text: Place the filled shot glasses back in the fridge for another 20 minutes.

20.text: Add whipped topping and some sprinkles before serving if you’d like.
